metadata.dc:author: Kunhardt Rasch, Jorge Ralf
Ortega Castillo, Verónica María de Jesús
Velázquez Sánchez, María del Pilar
metadata.dc:description: UNLABELLED Tension free vaginal tape is a minimally invasive surgical procedure for urinary incontinence treatment. Urethral erosion is an uncommon complication which presents in around 0.9% of the cases after the procedure. CASE Female of 68-year-old with an urodynamic diagnosis of type II stress urinary incontinence treated surgically with a tension free vaginal tape in February 2003 without any intraoperative complications. In the post-op she had acute urinary retention for one week, needing a transurethral catheter. Three months after surgery she reported dysuria, hematuria, frequency and urgency; the physical examination was normal with a positive urine culture to Escherichia coli sensitive to Nitrofurantoine. A cystoscopy was performed with the following findings: the tape was found in 25% of the right lower quadrant mid third of the urethra, the tape was cut vaginally without any further complications.
metadata.dc:title: Erosión uretral secundaria a la colocación de una cinta vaginal libre de tensión. Reporte de un caso.
[Urethral erosion secondary to the placing of tension-free vaginal tape. A case report].
